Our latest baseline (all modules) Joule w/document grounding
Login with ghill/sfadmin


WalkMe Demo Extension Configuration

1. Install this PropelDemo extension in your browser (use Chrome browser) -

https://me-download.walkme.com/downloadPage.html?guid=a6fa3560d4c711eea9ac179d71c807fb&customer=PropelDemo&profile=default&cdnName=aws&customExtension=false&isNewExtension=true

2. Open the Extensions options page, then open the "Walkme Extension For DAP" Options -

Ôøº

3. Enter the following password at the prompt below - wmBuilderMode


4. Toggle on the "Enable Environment Change" -
Ôøº
5. Go back to the extensions page and pin the "WalkMe Extension for DAP" icon so it is visible to the right of your browser URL box -

6. Select the "Propel" demo environment for the WalkMe extension (you may not see this or the "WalkMe loaded successfully" until you are in the demo environments)

Ôøº

notes.title: Joule Studio

notes.content:
Key Competitive Differentiators:

1. INTEGRATION
- Workday: Fragmented after 14+ acquisitions, contradicts one code base
- SAP: Seamless BTP integration across ERP suite, lower TCO

2. AI CAPABILITIES
- Workday: Illuminate AI mostly vaporware, acquired tech (HiredScore, Evisort)
- SAP: Joule AI production-ready across HCM, S/4HANA, SAC with AI Agents

3. PARTNER ECOSYSTEM
- Workday: Closed walled garden, limited 3rd-party integrations
- SAP: 500+ partners, 300+ apps, industry-specific solutions

4. GLOBAL REACH
- Workday: Core HR required, payroll in handful of countries
- SAP: SAGE strategy (Start Anywhere), 50+ countries, 100+ localizations

5. ERP COMPLETENESS
- Workday: HCM-only, no full ERP
- SAP: Complete ERP suite (finance, supply chain, procurement)

Positioning: SAP = mature, integrated, flexible; Workday = fragmented, restrictive, immature AI
notes.title: Workday vs SF - Competitive Talking Points
